When prompted for text input, enter your: When prompted for text input, enter your custom domain's email address you're forwarding from (e.g. "hello@example.com" - this will help you keep track in case you use this service for multiple accounts)
When prompted for \"Name\", enter the na: When prompted for "Name", enter the name that you want your email to be seen as "From" (e.g. "Elon Musk")
When prompted for \"Email address\", ent: When prompted for "Email address", enter the email address with the custom domain you used above (e.g. "hello@example.com")
When prompted for \"SMTP Server\", enter: When prompted for "SMTP Server", enter "smtp.gmail.com" and leave the port as "587"

Once you have followed the previous step: Once you have followed the previous step(s), you will need to "purge" the DNS cache using the "Purge Cache" tool by Cloudflare.  You can optionally purge the cache using Google as well if you are using Gmail.  Make sure to purge both the "TXT" and the "MX" records on your domain name's DNS records.  Wait a few minutes (or sometimes it might take an hour or two), and then click "Verify Records" above and try sending a test email to yourself.
